alert.note: Alert for Casey; Lincoln (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 6:56PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lincoln and east central Casey Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Liberty, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Lincoln and east central Casey Counties, including the following locations... South Fork, Lawhorn Hill, Kings Mountain, Mount Salem, Walltown, Middleburg, Lanhamtown, Waynesburg, Beech Bottom and New Salem. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
